titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson, Jr., Receipt to Gray & Todd
CWG13712

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To Gray & Todd Dr.

row.cell: To 420 Complete rations furnished 7th Ky Cavarly @ 20Â¢ --

body.p: This reg. was ordered to report to Adjt Genl of Ky for reorganization and was ordered to Frankfort by the Governor

Approved
By order of the Governor
Jno. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky Vols
I certify that the above account is correct and just; and that the articles were furnished as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service.
W. O Smith Majr Comdg. K. C.
Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 24 of Jany, 1863, of James F Robinson Jr., Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Eighty Four Dollars and Cents, in full of the above account.

No. 12.
No. 38 Abstract B C Qr. 186
Gray & Todd
Dollars 84x/100
Paid Jany 24" 1863
Subsistence
